content.title: Kisan Vikas Patra Scheme
content.details: The ‘Kisan Vikas Patra (KVP)’ is a certificate savings scheme that was launched by the Government of India on 1st April 1988. The scheme provided a facility of unlimited investment by way of purchase of certificates from post offices in various denominations. The maturity period of the scheme when launched was 5 ½ years and the money invested doubled on maturity. However, the scheme was relaunched in 2014 to revitalize Small Savings.
benefits: The scheme offers an interest rate of 7.5 % compounded annually on investment.
Amount Invested doubles in 115 months (9 years & 7 months).
Accounts can be opened in Post offices and in authorized banks.
KVP can be transferred from one person to another and from one post office to another.
KVP can be encashed after 2 and half years from the date of investment at the specified rates.
eligibility: Any individual who is a resident of India can avail of the benefits under the scheme.
A parent/guardian may invest on behalf of a minor or person of unsound mind.
The minimum age of minors should be 10 years.
documents_required: Proof of age i.e. Birth Certificate
Officially valid documents for identification and address proof (e.g., Passport, Driving license, Voter’s ID card, Job card issued by NREGA, Letter issued by the National Population Register)

faqs.question: Can I transfer my KVP account to someone else?
faqs.answer: Yes, KVP accounts can be transferred to another eligible individual.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Kisan Vikas Patra?
faqs.answer: Any individual who is a resident of India can avail of the benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there a maximum limit on the investment amount?
faqs.answer: No, there is no maximum deposit limit.

faqs.question: What is the interest rate offered by Kisan Vikas Patra?
faqs.answer: The scheme offers an interest rate of 7.5 % compounded annually on investment.

faqs.question: What is the tenure of a Kisan Vikas Patra (KVP) account?
faqs.answer: The tenure is 115 months (9 years & 7 months).

faqs.question: How do I open a Kisan Vikas Patra account?
faqs.answer: Any person can present an application either in person or through an authorized agent at a Post Office or Bank.

faqs.question: Can I nominate someone for my KVP account?
Can I prematurely close my KVP account?
faqs.answer: Yes, KVP may be prematurely closed under certain conditions.
